error.msg: Too many #ifdef configurations - cppcheck only checks 12 configurations. Use --force to check all configurations. For more details, use --enable=information.
error.verbose: The checking of the file will be interrupted because there are too many #ifdef configurations. Checking of all #ifdef configurations can be forced by --force command line option or from GUI preferences. However that may increase the checking time. For more details, use --enable=information.

error.msg: Assigning a pointer to an integer is not portable.
error.verbose: Assigning a pointer to an integer (int/long/etc) is not portable across different platforms and compilers. For example in 32-bit Windows and linux they are same width, but in 64-bit Windows and linux they are of different width. In worst case you end up assigning 64-bit address to 32-bit integer. The safe way is to store addresses only in pointer types (or typedefs like uintptr_t).

error.msg: Assigning an integer to a pointer is not portable.
error.verbose: Assigning an integer (int/long/etc) to a pointer is not portable across different platforms and compilers. For example in 32-bit Windows and linux they are same width, but in 64-bit Windows and linux they are of different width. In worst case you end up assigning 64-bit integer to 32-bit pointer. The safe way is to store addresses only in pointer types (or typedefs like uintptr_t).

error.msg: Returning an integer in a function with pointer return type is not portable.
error.verbose: Returning an integer (int/long/etc) in a function with pointer return type is not portable across different platforms and compilers. For example in 32-bit Windows and Linux they are same width, but in 64-bit Windows and Linux they are of different width. In worst case you end up casting 64-bit integer down to 32-bit pointer. The safe way is to always return a pointer.

error.msg: Returning an address value in a function with integer return type is not portable.
error.verbose: Returning an address value in a function with integer (int/long/etc) return type is not portable across different platforms and compilers. For example in 32-bit Windows and Linux they are same width, but in 64-bit Windows and Linux they are of different width. In worst case you end up casting 64-bit address down to 32-bit integer. The safe way is to always return an integer.

error.msg: Mismatching assignment and comparison, comparison '' is always false.
error.verbose: Mismatching assignment and comparison, comparison '' is always false.

error.msg: Expression '(X & 0x6) == 0x1' is always false.
error.verbose: The expression '(X & 0x6) == 0x1' is always false. Check carefully constants and operators used, these errors might be hard to spot sometimes. In case of complex expression it might help to split it to separate expressions.

error.msg: Expression is always false because 'else if' condition matches previous condition at line 1.
error.verbose: Expression is always false because 'else if' condition matches previous condition at line 1.

error.msg: Mismatching bitmasks. Result is always 0 (X = Y & 0xf0; Z = X & 0x1; => Z=0).
error.verbose: Mismatching bitmasks. Result is always 0 (X = Y & 0xf0; Z = X & 0x1; => Z=0).

error.msg: Address of local auto-variable assigned to a function parameter.
error.verbose: Dangerous assignment - the function parameter is assigned the address of a local auto-variable. Local auto-variables are reserved from the stack which is freed when the function ends. So the pointer to a local variable is invalid after the function ends.

error.msg: Address of an auto-variable returned.
error.verbose: Address of an auto-variable returned.

error.msg: Pointer to local array variable returned.
error.verbose: Pointer to local array variable returned.

error.msg: Reference to auto variable returned.
error.verbose: Reference to auto variable returned.

error.msg: Reference to temporary returned.
error.verbose: Reference to temporary returned.

error.msg: Deallocation of an auto-variable results in undefined behaviour.
error.verbose: The deallocation of an auto-variable results in undefined behaviour. You should only free memory that has been allocated dynamically.

error.msg: Address of function parameter 'parameter' returned.
error.verbose: Address of the function parameter 'parameter' becomes invalid after the function exits because function parameters are stored on the stack which is freed when the function exits. Thus the returned value is invalid.

error.msg: Assignment of function parameter has no effect outside the function.
error.verbose: Assignment of function parameter has no effect outside the function.

error.msg: Boolean value assigned to pointer.
error.verbose: Boolean value assigned to pointer.

error.msg: Comparison of a function returning boolean value using relational (<, >, <= or >=) operator.
error.verbose: The return type of function 'func_name' is 'bool' and result is of type 'bool'. Comparing 'bool' value using relational (<, >, <= or >=) operator could cause unexpected results.

error.msg: Comparison of two functions returning boolean value using relational (<, >, <= or >=) operator.
error.verbose: The return type of function 'func_name1' and function 'func_name2' is 'bool' and result is of type 'bool'. Comparing 'bool' value using relational (<, >, <= or >=) operator could cause unexpected results.

error.msg: Comparison of a variable having boolean value using relational (<, >, <= or >=) operator.
error.verbose: The variable 'var_name' is of type 'bool' and comparing 'bool' value using relational (<, >, <= or >=) operator could cause unexpected results.

error.msg: Incrementing a variable of type 'bool' with postfix operator++ is deprecated by the C++ Standard. You should assign it the value 'true' instead.
error.verbose: The operand of a postfix increment operator may be of type bool but it is deprecated by C++ Standard (Annex D-1) and the operand is always set to true. You should assign it the value 'true' instead.

error.msg: Comparison of a boolean with an integer that is neither 1 nor 0.
error.verbose: The expression 'varname' is of type 'bool' and it is compared against an integer value that is neither 1 nor 0.

error.msg: Boolean variable 'varname' is used in bitwise operation. Did you mean '&&'?
error.verbose: Boolean variable 'varname' is used in bitwise operation. Did you mean '&&'?

error.msg: Comparison of a boolean expression with an integer other than 0 or 1.
error.verbose: Comparison of a boolean expression with an integer other than 0 or 1.

error.msg: BOOST_FOREACH caches the end() iterator. It's undefined behavior if you modify the container inside.
error.verbose: BOOST_FOREACH caches the end() iterator. It's undefined behavior if you modify the container inside.

error.msg: Array 'array[2]' accessed at index 2, which is out of bounds.
error.verbose: Array 'array[2]' accessed at index 2, which is out of bounds.

error.msg: Buffer is accessed out of bounds: buffer
error.verbose: Buffer is accessed out of bounds: buffer

error.msg: index is out of bounds: Supplied size 2 is larger than actual size 1.
error.verbose: index is out of bounds: Supplied size 2 is larger than actual size 1.

error.msg: The buffer 'buffer' may not be null-terminated after the call to strncpy().
error.verbose: If the source string's size fits or exceeds the given size, strncpy() does not add a zero at the end of the buffer. This causes bugs later in the code if the code assumes buffer is null-terminated.

error.msg: The buffer 'buffer' is not null-terminated after the call to strncpy().
error.verbose: The buffer 'buffer' is not null-terminated after the call to strncpy(). This will cause bugs later in the code if the code assumes the buffer is null-terminated.

error.msg: Array index -1 is out of bounds.
error.verbose: Array index -1 is out of bounds.

error.msg: Buffer overrun possible for long command line arguments.
error.verbose: Buffer overrun possible for long command line arguments.

error.msg: Undefined behaviour: Pointer arithmetic result does not point into or just past the end of the array.
error.verbose: Undefined behaviour: The result of this pointer arithmetic does not point into or just one element past the end of the array. Further information: https://www.securecoding.cert.org/confluence/display/seccode/ARR30-C.+Do+not+form+or+use+out+of+bounds+pointers+or+array+subscripts

error.msg: Array index 'index' is used before limits check.
error.verbose: Defensive programming: The variable 'index' is used as an array index before it is check that is within limits. This can mean that the array might be accessed out of bounds. Reorder conditions such as '(a[i] && i < 10)' to '(i < 10 && a[i])'. That way the array will not be accessed if the index is out of limits.

error.msg: Possible buffer overflow if strlen(source) is larger than or equal to sizeof(destination).
error.verbose: Possible buffer overflow if strlen(source) is larger than or equal to sizeof(destination). The source buffer is larger than the destination buffer so there is the potential for overflowing the destination buffer.

error.msg: readlink() might return the full size of 'buffer'. Lower the supplied size by one.
error.verbose: readlink() might return the full size of 'buffer'. If a buffer[len] = '\0'; statement follows, it will overrun the buffer. Lower the supplied size by one.

error.msg: The array 'array' is too small, the function 'function' expects a bigger one.
error.verbose: The array 'array' is too small, the function 'function' expects a bigger one.

error.msg: Writing 1 bytes outside buffer size.
error.verbose: The number of bytes to write (3 bytes) are bigger than the source buffer (2 bytes). Please check the second and the third parameter of the function 'write'.

error.msg: The class 'classname' does not have a constructor.
error.verbose: The class 'classname' does not have a constructor although it has private member variables. Member variables of builtin types are left uninitialized when the class is instanciated. That may cause bugs or undefined behavior.

error.msg: Value of pointer 'var', which points to allocated memory, is copied in copy constructor instead of allocating new memory.
error.verbose: Value of pointer 'var', which points to allocated memory, is copied in copy constructor instead of allocating new memory.

error.msg: 'class class' does not have a copy constructor which is recommended since the class contains a pointer to allocated memory.
error.verbose: 'class class' does not have a copy constructor which is recommended since the class contains a pointer to allocated memory.

error.msg: Member variable 'classname::varname' is not initialized in the constructor.
error.verbose: Member variable 'classname::varname' is not initialized in the constructor.

error.msg: Member variable 'classname::' is not assigned a value in 'classname::operator='.
error.verbose: Member variable 'classname::' is not assigned a value in 'classname::operator='.

error.msg: Unused private function: 'classname::funcname'
error.verbose: Unused private function: 'classname::funcname'

error.msg: Using 'memfunc' on class that contains a classname.
error.verbose: Using 'memfunc' on class that contains a classname.

error.msg: Memory for class instance allocated with malloc(), but class provides constructors.
error.verbose: Memory for class instance allocated with malloc(), but class provides constructors. This is unsafe, since no constructor is called and class members remain uninitialized. Consider using 'new' instead.

error.msg: Memory for class instance allocated with malloc(), but class contains a std::string.
error.verbose: Memory for class instance allocated with malloc(), but class a std::string. This is unsafe, since no constructor is called and class members remain uninitialized. Consider using 'new' instead.

error.msg: 'class::operator=' should return 'class &'.
error.verbose: 'class::operator=' should return 'class &'.

error.msg: Class 'Base' which is inherited by class 'Derived' does not have a virtual destructor.
error.verbose: Class 'Base' which is inherited by class 'Derived' does not have a virtual destructor. If you destroy instances of the derived class by deleting a pointer that points to the base class, only the destructor of the base class is executed. Thus, dynamic memory that is managed by the derived class could leak. This can be avoided by adding a virtual destructor to the base class.

error.msg: Suspicious pointer subtraction. Did you intend to write '->'?
error.verbose: Suspicious pointer subtraction. Did you intend to write '->'?

error.msg: 'operator=' should return reference to 'this' instance.
error.verbose: 'operator=' should return reference to 'this' instance.

error.msg: 'operator=' should check for assignment to self to avoid problems with dynamic memory.
error.verbose: 'operator=' should check for assignment to self to ensure that each block of dynamically allocated memory is owned and managed by only one instance of the class.

error.msg: Technically the member function 'class::function' can be const.
error.verbose: The member function 'class::function' can be made a const function. Making this function 'const' should not cause compiler errors. Even though the function can be made const function technically it may not make sense conceptually. Think about your design and the task of the function first - is it a function that must not change object internal state?

error.msg: Technically the member function 'class::function' can be static.
error.verbose: The member function 'class::function' can be made a static function. Making a function static can bring a performance benefit since no 'this' instance is passed to the function. This change should not cause compiler errors but it does not necessarily make sense conceptually. Think about your design and the task of the function first - is it a function that must not access members of class instances?

error.msg: Member variable 'class::variable' is in the wrong place in the initializer list.
error.verbose: Member variable 'class::variable' is in the wrong place in the initializer list. Members are initialized in the order they are declared, not in the order they are in the initializer list. Keeping the initializer list in the same order that the members were declared prevents order dependent initialization errors.

error.msg: Variable 'variable' is assigned in constructor body. Consider performing initialization in initialization list.
error.verbose: When an object of a class is created, the constructors of all member variables are called consecutively in the order the variables are declared, even if you don't explicitly write them to the initialization list. You could avoid assigning 'variable' a value by passing the value to the constructor in the initialization list.

error.msg: Exception thrown in destructor.
error.verbose: Exception thrown in destructor.

error.msg: Exception thrown in invalid state, 'p' points at deallocated memory.
error.verbose: Exception thrown in invalid state, 'p' points at deallocated memory.

error.msg: Throwing a copy of the caught exception instead of rethrowing the original exception.
error.verbose: Rethrowing an exception with 'throw varname;' creates an unnecessary copy of 'varname'. To rethrow the caught exception without unnecessary copying or slicing, use a bare 'throw;'.

error.msg: Exception should be caught by reference.
error.verbose: The exception is caught by value. It could be caught as a (const) reference which is usually recommended in C++.

error.msg: Invalid usage of output stream: '<< std::cout'.
error.verbose: Invalid usage of output stream: '<< std::cout'.

error.msg: fflush() called on input stream 'stdin' results in undefined behaviour.
error.verbose: fflush() called on input stream 'stdin' results in undefined behaviour.

error.msg: Read and write operations without a call to a positioning function (fseek, fsetpos or rewind) or fflush in between result in undefined behaviour.
error.verbose: Read and write operations without a call to a positioning function (fseek, fsetpos or rewind) or fflush in between result in undefined behaviour.

error.msg: Read operation on a file that was opened only for writing.
error.verbose: Read operation on a file that was opened only for writing.

error.msg: Write operation on a file that was opened only for reading.
error.verbose: Write operation on a file that was opened only for reading.

error.msg: Used file that is not opened.
error.verbose: Used file that is not opened.

error.msg: scanf without field width limits can crash with huge input data.
printf format string has 3 parameters but only 2 are given.
error.verbose: printf format string has 3 parameters but only 2 are given.

error.msg: scanf argument no. 1: requires a non-const pointer or array as argument.
error.verbose: scanf argument no. 1: requires a non-const pointer or array as argument.

error.msg: %s in format string (no. 1) requires a char* given in the argument list.
error.verbose: %s in format string (no. 1) requires a char* given in the argument list.

error.msg: %n in format string (no. 1) requires a pointer to an non-const integer given in the argument list.
error.verbose: %n in format string (no. 1) requires a pointer to an non-const integer given in the argument list.

error.msg: %p in format string (no. 1) requires an address given in the argument list.
error.verbose: %p in format string (no. 1) requires an address given in the argument list.

error.msg: %X in format string (no. 1) requires an integer given in the argument list.
error.verbose: %X in format string (no. 1) requires an integer given in the argument list.

error.msg: %u in format string (no. 1) requires an unsigned integer given in the argument list.
error.verbose: %u in format string (no. 1) requires an unsigned integer given in the argument list.

error.msg: %i in format string (no. 1) requires a signed integer given in the argument list.
error.verbose: %i in format string (no. 1) requires a signed integer given in the argument list.

error.msg: %f in format string (no. 1) requires a floating point number given in the argument list.
error.verbose: %f in format string (no. 1) requires a floating point number given in the argument list.

error.msg: printf: referencing parameter 2 while 1 arguments given
error.verbose: printf: referencing parameter 2 while 1 arguments given

error.msg: Returning/dereferencing 'p' after it is deallocated / released
error.verbose: Returning/dereferencing 'p' after it is deallocated / released

error.msg: Allocation with funcName, funcName doesn't release it.
error.verbose: Allocation with funcName, funcName doesn't release it.

error.msg: Possible leak in public function. The pointer 'varname' is not deallocated before it is allocated.
error.verbose: Possible leak in public function. The pointer 'varname' is not deallocated before it is allocated.

error.msg: Class 'class' is unsafe, 'class::varname' can leak by wrong usage.
error.verbose: The class 'class' is unsafe, wrong usage can cause memory/resource leaks for 'class::varname'. This can for instance be fixed by adding proper cleanup in the destructor.

error.msg: Memory leak: varname
error.verbose: Memory leak: varname

error.msg: Resource leak: varname
error.verbose: Resource leak: varname

error.msg: Deallocating a deallocated pointer: varname
error.verbose: Deallocating a deallocated pointer: varname

error.msg: Dereferencing 'varname' after it is deallocated / released
error.verbose: Dereferencing 'varname' after it is deallocated / released

error.msg: The given size sz is mismatching
error.verbose: The given size sz is mismatching

error.msg: Mismatching allocation and deallocation: varname
error.verbose: Mismatching allocation and deallocation: varname

error.msg: Common realloc mistake: 'varname' nulled but not freed upon failure
error.verbose: Common realloc mistake: 'varname' nulled but not freed upon failure

error.verbose: Non reentrant function 'crypt' called. For threadsafe applications it is recommended to use the reentrant replacement function 'crypt_r'.

error.msg: Obsolete function 'bcmp' called. It is recommended to use the function 'memcmp' instead.
error.verbose: Obsolete function 'bcmp' called. It is recommended to use the function 'memcmp' instead.

error.msg: Obsolete function 'bcopy' called. It is recommended to use the 'memmove' or 'memcpy' function instead.
error.verbose: Obsolete function 'bcopy' called. It is recommended to use the 'memmove' or 'memcpy' function instead.

error.msg: Obsolete function 'bsd_signal' called. It is recommended to use the function 'sigaction' instead.
error.verbose: Obsolete function 'bsd_signal' called. It is recommended to use the function 'sigaction' instead.

error.msg: Obsolete function 'bzero' called. It is recommended to use the function 'memset' instead.
error.verbose: Obsolete function 'bzero' called. It is recommended to use the function 'memset' instead.

error.msg: Obsolete function 'ctime_r' called. It is recommended to use the function 'strftime' instead.
error.verbose: Obsolete function 'ctime_r' called. It is recommended to use the function 'strftime' instead.

error.msg: Obsolete function 'ecvt' called. It is recommended to use the function 'sprintf' instead.
error.verbose: Obsolete function 'ecvt' called. It is recommended to use the function 'sprintf' instead.

error.msg: Obsolete function 'fcvt' called. It is recommended to use the function 'sprintf' instead.
error.verbose: Obsolete function 'fcvt' called. It is recommended to use the function 'sprintf' instead.

error.msg: Obsolete function 'ftime' called. It is recommended to use time(), gettimeofday() or clock_gettime() instead.
error.verbose: Obsolete function 'ftime' called. It is recommended to use time(), gettimeofday() or clock_gettime() instead.

error.msg: Obsolete function 'gcvt' called. It is recommended to use the function 'sprintf' instead.
error.verbose: Obsolete function 'gcvt' called. It is recommended to use the function 'sprintf' instead.

error.msg: Obsolete function 'getcontext' called. Due to portability issues, applications are recommended to be rewritten to use POSIX threads.
error.verbose: Obsolete function 'getcontext' called. Due to portability issues, applications are recommended to be rewritten to use POSIX threads.

error.msg: Obsolete function 'gethostbyaddr' called. It is recommended to use the function 'getnameinfo' instead.
error.verbose: Obsolete function 'gethostbyaddr' called. It is recommended to use the function 'getnameinfo' instead.

error.msg: Obsolete function 'gethostbyname' called. It is recommended to use the function 'getaddrinfo' instead.
error.verbose: Obsolete function 'gethostbyname' called. It is recommended to use the function 'getaddrinfo' instead.

error.msg: Obsolete function 'getwd' called. It is recommended to use the function 'getcwd' instead.
error.verbose: Obsolete function 'getwd' called. It is recommended to use the function 'getcwd' instead.

error.msg: Obsolete function 'index' called. It is recommended to use the function 'strchr' instead.
error.verbose: Obsolete function 'index' called. It is recommended to use the function 'strchr' instead.

error.msg: Obsolete function 'makecontext' called. Due to portability issues, applications are recommended to be rewritten to use POSIX threads.
error.verbose: Obsolete function 'makecontext' called. Due to portability issues, applications are recommended to be rewritten to use POSIX threads.

error.msg: Obsolete function 'pthread_attr_getstackaddr' called. It is recommended to use the function 'pthread_attr_getstack' instead.
error.verbose: Obsolete function 'pthread_attr_getstackaddr' called. It is recommended to use the function 'pthread_attr_getstack' instead.

error.msg: Obsolete function 'pthread_attr_setstackaddr' called. It is recommended to use the function 'pthread_attr_setstack' instead.
error.verbose: Obsolete function 'pthread_attr_setstackaddr' called. It is recommended to use the function 'pthread_attr_setstack' instead.

error.msg: Obsolete function 'rand_r' called. It is recommended to use the function 'rand' instead.
error.verbose: Obsolete function 'rand_r' called. It is recommended to use the function 'rand' instead.

error.msg: Obsolete function 'rindex' called. It is recommended to use the function 'strrchr' instead.
error.verbose: Obsolete function 'rindex' called. It is recommended to use the function 'strrchr' instead.

error.msg: Obsolete function 'scalb' called. It is recommended to use 'scalbln', 'scalblnf' or 'scalblnl' instead.
error.verbose: Obsolete function 'scalb' called. It is recommended to use 'scalbln', 'scalblnf' or 'scalblnl' instead.

error.msg: Obsolete function 'swapcontext' called. Due to portability issues, applications are recommended to be rewritten to use POSIX threads.
error.verbose: Obsolete function 'swapcontext' called. Due to portability issues, applications are recommended to be rewritten to use POSIX threads.

error.msg: Obsolete function 'tmpnam' called. It is recommended to use 'tmpfile', 'mkstemp' or 'mkdtemp' instead.
error.verbose: Obsolete function 'tmpnam' called. It is recommended to use 'tmpfile', 'mkstemp' or 'mkdtemp' instead.

error.msg: Obsolete function 'tmpnam_r' called. It is recommended to use 'tmpfile', 'mkstemp' or 'mkdtemp' instead.
error.verbose: Obsolete function 'tmpnam_r' called. It is recommended to use 'tmpfile', 'mkstemp' or 'mkdtemp' instead.

error.msg: Obsolete function 'ualarm' called. It is recommended to use 'timer_create', 'timer_delete', 'timer_getoverrun', 'timer_gettime' or 'timer_settime' instead.
error.verbose: Obsolete function 'ualarm' called. It is recommended to use 'timer_create', 'timer_delete', 'timer_getoverrun', 'timer_gettime' or 'timer_settime' instead.

error.msg: Obsolete function 'usleep' called. It is recommended to use the 'nanosleep' or 'setitimer' function instead.
error.verbose: The obsolete function 'usleep' is called. POSIX.1-2001 declares usleep() function obsolete and POSIX.1-2008 removes it. It is recommended that new applications use the 'nanosleep' or 'setitimer' function.

error.msg: Obsolete function 'utime' called. It is recommended to use the function 'utimensat' instead.
error.verbose: Obsolete function 'utime' called. It is recommended to use the function 'utimensat' instead.

error.msg: Obsolete function 'vfork' called. It is recommended to use the function 'fork' instead.
error.verbose: Obsolete function 'vfork' called. It is recommended to use the function 'fork' instead.

error.msg: Obsolete function 'wcswcs' called. It is recommended to use the function 'wcsstr' instead.
error.verbose: Obsolete function 'wcswcs' called. It is recommended to use the function 'wcsstr' instead.

error.msg: Undefined behavior: Variable 'varname' is used as parameter and destination in s[n]printf().
error.verbose: The variable 'varname' is used both as a parameter and as destination in s[n]printf(). The origin and destination buffers overlap. Quote from glibc (C-library) documentation (http://www.gnu.org/software/libc/manual/html_mono/libc.html#Formatted-Output-Functions): "If copying takes place between objects that overlap as a result of a call to sprintf() or snprintf(), the results are undefined."

error.msg: Unsigned division. The result will be wrong.
error.verbose: Unsigned division. The result will be wrong.

error.msg: Division by zero.
error.verbose: Division by zero.

error.msg: Passing value '#' to #() leads to undefined result.
error.verbose: Passing value '#' to #() leads to undefined result.

error.msg: Instance of 'varname' object is destroyed immediately.
error.verbose: Instance of 'varname' object is destroyed immediately.

error.msg: Memory pointed to by 'varname' is freed twice.
error.verbose: Memory pointed to by 'varname' is freed twice.

error.msg: Casting between float* and double* which have an incompatible binary data representation.
error.verbose: Casting between float* and double* which have an incompatible binary data representation.

error.msg: Shifting by a negative value.
error.verbose: Shifting by a negative value.

error.msg: Buffer 'varname' must have size of 2 integers if used as parameter of pipe().
error.verbose: The pipe()/pipe2() system command takes an argument, which is an array of exactly two integers. The variable 'varname' is an array of size dimension, which does not match.

error.msg: The argument of usleep must be less than 1000000.
error.verbose: The argument of usleep must be less than 1000000, but dimension is provided.

error.msg: Use const reference for 'varname' to avoid unnecessary data copying.
error.verbose: The const variable 'varname' is assigned a copy of the data. You can avoid the unnecessary data copying by converting 'varname' to const reference.

error.msg: Buffer 'var' is being written before its old content has been used.
error.verbose: Buffer 'var' is being written before its old content has been used.

error.msg: Variable 'var' is reassigned a value before the old one has been used.
error.verbose: Variable 'var' is reassigned a value before the old one has been used.

error.msg: Storing func_name() return value in char variable and then comparing with EOF.
error.verbose: When saving func_name() return value in char variable there is loss of precision. When func_name() returns EOF this value is truncated. Comparing the char variable with EOF can have unexpected results. For instance a loop "while (EOF != (c = func_name());" loops forever on some compilers/platforms and on other compilers/platforms it will stop when the file contains a matching character.

error.msg: Opposite conditions in nested 'if' blocks lead to a dead code block.
error.verbose: Opposite conditions in nested 'if' blocks lead to a dead code block.

error.msg: C-style pointer casting
error.verbose: C-style pointer casting

error.msg: Invalid radix in call to strtol(). It must be 0 or 2-36.
error.verbose: Invalid radix in call to strtol(). It must be 0 or 2-36.

error.msg: Function parameter 'parametername' should be passed by reference.
error.verbose: Parameter 'parametername' is passed by value. It could be passed as a (const) reference which is usually faster and recommended in C++.

error.msg: Redundant code: Found a statement that begins with type constant.
error.verbose: Redundant code: Found a statement that begins with type constant.

error.msg: Signed 'char' type used as array index.
error.verbose: Signed 'char' type used as array index. If the value can be greater than 127 there will be a buffer underflow because of sign extension.

error.msg: When using 'char' variables in bit operations, sign extension can generate unexpected results.
The scope of the variable 'varname' can be reduced.
Unusual pointer arithmetic. A value of type 'char' is added to a string literal.
error.verbose: Unusual pointer arithmetic. A value of type 'char' is added to a string literal.

error.msg: Variable 'var' is reassigned a value before the old one has been used. 'break;' missing?
error.verbose: Variable 'var' is reassigned a value before the old one has been used. 'break;' missing?

error.msg: Buffer 'var' is being written before its old content has been used. 'break;' missing?
error.verbose: Buffer 'var' is being written before its old content has been used. 'break;' missing?

error.msg: Switch falls through case without comment. 'break;' missing?
error.verbose: Switch falls through case without comment. 'break;' missing?

error.msg: Found suspicious case label in switch(). Operator '||' probably doesn't work as intended.
error.verbose: Using an operator like '||' in a case label is suspicious. Did you intend to use a bitwise operator, multiple case labels or if/else instead?

error.msg: Found suspicious equality comparison. Did you intend to assign a value instead?
error.verbose: Found suspicious equality comparison. Did you intend to assign a value instead?

error.msg: Redundant assignment of 'varname' to itself.
error.verbose: Redundant assignment of 'varname' to itself.

error.msg: Logical disjunction always evaluates to true: foo > 3 && foo < 4.
error.verbose: Logical disjunction always evaluates to true: foo > 3 && foo < 4. Are these conditions necessary? Did you intend to use && instead? Are the numbers correct? Are you comparing the correct variables?

error.msg: Redundant condition: If x > 10 the condition x > 11 is always true.
error.verbose: Redundant condition: If x > 10 the condition x > 11 is always true.

error.msg: memset() called to fill 0 bytes of 'varname'.
error.verbose: memset() called to fill 0 bytes of 'varname'. Second and third arguments might be inverted.

error.msg: Clarify calculation precedence for '+' and '?'.
error.verbose: Suspicious calculation. Please use parentheses to clarify the code. The code ''a+b?c:d'' should be written as either ''(a+b)?c:d'' or ''a+(b?c:d)''.

error.msg: Suspicious condition (assignment + comparison); Clarify expression with parentheses.
error.verbose: Suspicious condition (assignment + comparison); Clarify expression with parentheses.

error.msg: Ineffective statement similar to '*A++;'. Did you intend to write '(*A)++;'?
error.verbose: A statement like '*A++;' might not do what you intended. Postfix 'operator++' is executed before 'operator*'. Thus, the dereference is meaningless. Did you intend to write '(*A)++;'?

error.msg: String literal "Hello World" doesn't match length argument for substr().
error.verbose: String literal "Hello World" doesn't match length argument for substr().

error.msg: String literal compared with variable 'foo'. Did you intend to use strcmp() instead?
error.verbose: String literal compared with variable 'foo'. Did you intend to use strcmp() instead?

error.msg: Conversion of string literal "Hello World" to bool always evaluates to true.
error.verbose: Conversion of string literal "Hello World" to bool always evaluates to true.

error.msg: Duplicate conditions in 'if' and related 'else if'.
error.verbose: Duplicate conditions in 'if' and related 'else if'. This is suspicious and might indicate a cut and paste or logic error. Please examine this code carefully to determine if it is correct.

error.msg: Found duplicate branches for 'if' and 'else'.
error.verbose: Finding the same code in an 'if' and related 'else' branch is suspicious and might indicate a cut and paste or logic error. Please examine this code carefully to determine if it is correct.

error.msg: Same expression on both sides of '&&'.
error.verbose: Finding the same expression on both sides of an operator is suspicious and might indicate a cut and paste or logic error. Please examine this code carefully to determine if it is correct.

error.msg: Unnecessary comparison of static strings.
error.verbose: The compared strings, 'str1' and 'str2', are always unequal. Therefore the comparison is unnecessary and looks suspicious.

error.msg: Comparison of identical string variables.
error.verbose: The compared strings, 'varname1' and 'varname2', are identical. This could be a logic bug.

error.msg: Consecutive return, break, continue, goto or throw statements are unnecessary.
error.verbose: Consecutive return, break, continue, goto or throw statements are unnecessary. The second statement can never be executed, and so should be removed.

error.msg: Statements following return, break, continue, goto or throw will never be executed.
error.verbose: Statements following return, break, continue, goto or throw will never be executed.

error.msg: Checking if unsigned variable 'varname' is less than zero.
error.verbose: The unsigned variable 'varname' will never be negative so it is either pointless or an error to check if it is.

error.msg: Unsigned variable 'varname' can't be negative so it is unnecessary to test it.
error.verbose: Unsigned variable 'varname' can't be negative so it is unnecessary to test it.

error.msg: A pointer can not be negative so it is either pointless or an error to check if it is.
error.verbose: A pointer can not be negative so it is either pointless or an error to check if it is.

error.msg: A pointer can not be negative so it is either pointless or an error to check if it is not.
error.verbose: A pointer can not be negative so it is either pointless or an error to check if it is not.

error.msg: Suspicious use of ; at the end of '' statement.
error.verbose: Suspicious use of ; at the end of '' statement.

error.msg: Passing value value to funname() causes undefined behavior which may lead to a crash.
error.verbose: Passing value value to funname() causes undefined behavior which may lead to a crash.

error.msg: Comparison of modulo result is predetermined, because it is always less than 1.
error.verbose: Comparison of modulo result is predetermined, because it is always less than 1.

error.msg: Array 'buffer' is filled incompletely. Did you forget to multiply the size given to 'memset()' with 'sizeof(*buffer)'?
error.verbose: The array 'buffer' is filled incompletely. The function 'memset()' needs the size given in bytes, but an element of the given array is larger than one byte. Did you forget to multiply the size with 'sizeof(*buffer)'?

error.msg: Passing NULL after the last typed argument to a variadic function leads to undefined behaviour.
Using NaN/Inf in a computation.
error.verbose: Using NaN/Inf in a computation. Although nothing bad really happens, it is suspicious.

error.msg: Comma is used in return statement. The comma can easily be misread as a ';'.
Invalid iterator: iterator
error.verbose: Invalid iterator: iterator

error.msg: Same iterator is used with different containers 'container1' and 'container2'.
error.verbose: Same iterator is used with different containers 'container1' and 'container2'.

error.msg: Iterators of different containers are used together.
error.verbose: Iterators of different containers are used together.

error.msg: Invalid iterator 'iter' used.
error.verbose: The iterator 'iter' is invalid before being assigned. Dereferencing or comparing it with another iterator is invalid operation.

error.msg: When i==foo.size(), foo[i] is out of bounds.
error.verbose: When i==foo.size(), foo[i] is out of bounds.

error.msg: After push_back|push_front|insert(), the iterator 'iterator' may be invalid.
error.verbose: After push_back|push_front|insert(), the iterator 'iterator' may be invalid.

error.msg: Invalid pointer 'pointer' after push_back().
error.verbose: Invalid pointer 'pointer' after push_back().

error.msg: Dangerous iterator comparison using operator< on 'std::container'.
error.verbose: Iterator of container 'std::container' compared with operator<. This is dangerous since the order of items in the container is not guaranteed. One should use operator!= instead to compare iterators.

error.msg: Suspicious condition. The result of find() is an iterator, but it is not properly checked.
error.verbose: Suspicious condition. The result of find() is an iterator, but it is not properly checked.

error.msg: Inefficient usage of string::find() in condition; string::compare() would be faster.
error.verbose: Either inefficient or wrong usage of string::find(). string::compare() will be faster if string::find's result is compared with 0, because it will not scan the whole string. If your intention is to check that there are no findings in the string, you should compare with std::string::npos.

error.msg: Dangerous usage of c_str(). The value returned by c_str() is invalid after this call.
error.verbose: Dangerous usage of c_str(). The c_str() return value is only valid until its string is deleted.

error.msg: Returning the result of c_str() in a function that returns std::string is slow and redundant.
error.verbose: The conversion from const char* as returned by c_str() to std::string creates an unnecessary string copy. Solve that by directly returning the string.

error.msg: Passing the result of c_str() to a function that takes std::string as argument no. 0 is slow and redundant.
error.verbose: The conversion from const char* as returned by c_str() to std::string creates an unnecessary string copy. Solve that by directly passing the string.

error.msg: Possible inefficient checking for 'list' emptiness.
error.verbose: Checking for 'list' emptiness might be inefficient. Using list.empty() instead of list.size() can be faster. list.size() can take linear time but list.empty() is guaranteed to take constant time.

error.msg: Missing bounds check for extra iterator increment in loop.
error.verbose: The iterator incrementing is suspicious - it is incremented at line and then at line . The loop might unintentionally skip an element in the container. There is no comparison between these increments to prevent that the iterator is incremented beyond the end.

error.msg: Redundant checking of STL container element existence before removing it.
error.verbose: Redundant checking of STL container element existence before removing it. It is safe to call the remove method on a non-existing element.

error.msg: Copying 'auto_ptr' pointer to another does not create two equal objects since one has lost its ownership of the pointer.
error.verbose: 'std::auto_ptr' has semantics of strict ownership, meaning that the 'auto_ptr' instance is the sole entity responsible for the object's lifetime. If an 'auto_ptr' is copied, the source looses the reference.

error.msg: You can randomly lose access to pointers if you store 'auto_ptr' pointers in an STL container.
error.verbose: An element of container must be able to be copied but 'auto_ptr' does not fulfill this requirement. You should consider to use 'shared_ptr' or 'unique_ptr'. It is suitable for use in containers, because they no longer copy their values, they move them.

error.msg: Object pointed by an 'auto_ptr' is destroyed using operator 'delete'. You should not use 'auto_ptr' for pointers obtained with operator 'new[]'.
error.verbose: Object pointed by an 'auto_ptr' is destroyed using operator 'delete'. This means that you should only use 'auto_ptr' for pointers obtained with operator 'new'. This excludes arrays, which are allocated by operator 'new[]' and must be deallocated by operator 'delete[]'.

error.msg: It is inefficient to call 'str.find(str)' as it always returns 0.
error.verbose: 'std::string::find()' returns zero when given itself as parameter (str.find(str)). As it is currently the code is inefficient. It is possible either the string searched ('str') or searched for ('str') is wrong.

error.msg: It is inefficient to swap a object with itself by calling 'str.swap(str)'
error.verbose: The 'swap()' function has no logical effect when given itself as parameter (str.swap(str)). As it is currently the code is inefficient. Is the object or the parameter wrong here?

error.msg: Ineffective call of function 'substr' because it returns a copy of the object. Use operator= instead.
error.verbose: Ineffective call of function 'substr' because it returns a copy of the object. Use operator= instead.

error.msg: Ineffective call of function 'empty()'. Did you intend to call 'clear()' instead?
error.verbose: Ineffective call of function 'empty()'. Did you intend to call 'clear()' instead?

error.msg: Return value of std::remove() ignored. Elements remain in container.
error.verbose: The return value of std::remove() is ignored. This function returns an iterator to the end of the range containing those elements that should be kept. Elements past new end remain valid but with unspecified values. Use the erase method of the container to delete them.

error.msg: Possible dereference of an invalid iterator: i
error.verbose: Make sure to check that the iterator is valid before dereferencing it - not after.

error.msg: Using 'sizeof' on array given as function argument returns size of a pointer.
Size of pointer 'varname' used instead of size of its data.
error.verbose: Size of pointer 'varname' used instead of size of its data. This is likely to lead to a buffer overflow. You probably intend to write 'sizeof(*varname)'.

error.msg: Suspicious usage of 'sizeof' with a numeric constant as parameter.
error.verbose: It is unusual to use a constant value with sizeof. For example, 'sizeof(10)' returns 4 (in 32-bit systems) or 8 (in 64-bit systems) instead of 10. 'sizeof('A')' and 'sizeof(char)' can return different results.

error.msg: Calling 'sizeof' on 'sizeof'.
error.verbose: Calling sizeof for 'sizeof looks like a suspicious code and most likely there should be just one 'sizeof'. The current code is equivalent to 'sizeof(size_t)'

error.msg: Found calculation inside sizeof().
error.verbose: Found calculation inside sizeof().

error.msg: Multiplying sizeof() with sizeof() indicates a logic error.
error.verbose: Multiplying sizeof() with sizeof() indicates a logic error.

error.msg: Division of result of sizeof() on pointer type.
error.verbose: Division of result of sizeof() on pointer type. sizeof() returns the size of the pointer, not the size of the memory area it points to.

error.msg: Behaviour of 'sizeof(void)' is not covered by the ISO C standard.
error.verbose: Behaviour of 'sizeof(void)' is not covered by the ISO C standard. A value for 'sizeof(void)' is defined only as part of a GNU C extension, which defines 'sizeof(void)' to be 1.

error.msg: '*varname' is of type 'void', the behaviour of 'sizeof(void)' is not covered by the ISO C standard.
error.verbose: '*varname' is of type 'void', the behaviour of 'sizeof(void)' is not covered by the ISO C standard. A value for 'sizeof(void)' is defined only as part of a GNU C extension, which defines 'sizeof(void)' to be 1.

error.msg: 'varname' is of type 'vartype'. When using void pointers in calculations, the behaviour is undefined.
error.verbose: 'varname' is of type 'vartype'. When using void pointers in calculations, the behaviour is undefined. Arithmetic operations on 'void *' is a GNU C extension, which defines the 'sizeof(void)' to be 1.

error.msg: Dangerous usage of 'varname' (strncpy doesn't always null-terminate it).
error.verbose: Dangerous usage of 'varname' (strncpy doesn't always null-terminate it).

error.msg: Memory is allocated but not initialized: varname
error.verbose: Memory is allocated but not initialized: varname

error.msg: Uninitialized variable: varname
error.verbose: Uninitialized variable: varname

error.msg: Uninitialized struct member: a.b
error.verbose: Uninitialized struct member: a.b

error.msg: The function 'funcName' is never used.
error.verbose: The function 'funcName' is never used.

error.msg: Unused variable: varname
error.verbose: Unused variable: varname

error.msg: Variable 'varname' is allocated memory that is never used.
error.verbose: Variable 'varname' is allocated memory that is never used.

error.msg: Variable 'varname' is assigned a value that is never used.
error.verbose: Variable 'varname' is assigned a value that is never used.

error.msg: Variable 'varname' is not assigned a value.
error.verbose: Variable 'varname' is not assigned a value.

error.msg: struct or union member 'structname::variable' is never used.
error.verbose: struct or union member 'structname::variable' is never used.

error.msg: Prefer prefix ++/-- operators for non-primitive types.
error.verbose: Prefix ++/-- operators should be preferred for non-primitive types. Pre-increment/decrement can be more efficient than post-increment/decrement. Post-increment/decrement usually involves keeping a copy of the previous value around and adds a little extra code.

error.msg: Invalid number of character ( ) when these macros are defined: ''.
error.verbose: Invalid number of character ( ) when these macros are defined: ''.

error.msg: Analysis failed. If the code is valid then please report this failure.
error.verbose: Analysis failed. If the code is valid then please report this failure.

error.msg: The variable 'name' hides a typedef with the same name.
error.verbose: The variable 'name' hides a typedef with the same name.

error.msg: The variable 'name' forward declaration is unnecessary. Type variable is already declared earlier.
error.verbose: The variable 'name' forward declaration is unnecessary. Type variable is already declared earlier.

error.msg: variable 'name' hides enumerator with same name
error.verbose: variable 'name' hides enumerator with same name

error.msg: The extra qualification 'type' is unnecessary and is considered an error by many compilers.
error.verbose: The extra qualification 'type' is unnecessary and is considered an error by many compilers.

error.msg: Include file: "" not found.
error.verbose: Include file: "" not found.

error.msg: Include file: <> not found.
error.verbose: Include file: <> not found.

error.msg: Skipping configuration 'X' since the value of 'X' is unknown. Use -D if you want to check it. You can use -U to skip it explicitly.
error.verbose: Skipping configuration 'X' since the value of 'X' is unknown. Use -D if you want to check it. You can use -U to skip it explicitly.

error.msg: #error message
error.verbose: #error message
